namespaces.namespace: NOAA Environmental Data Management Wiki talk

revision.text:
This metadata template describes the cruise or survey that collected data for ECS. This is a collaborative effort between the NOAA National Geophysical Data Center, the NOAA National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), the Rolling Deck to Repository (R2R), the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), and the University of New Hampshire (UNH). This template is designed with the ISO 19115, ISO 19115-2 and ISO 19139 metadata standards. You may use the XML Schema document (XSD) to validate the XML and the Schematron file to check for compliance of specific cruise level information. ==Guide== * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Training/Guides/cruise_template_guide.html Template Guide] * [[ISO Template Vocabularies|Vocabulary]] ==XML Template of Cruise Level Metadata== This is an xml template that can be used to begin the development of your cruise level metadata record. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Examples/iso_u/xml/template_cruise.xml Template] ** Right click on link, select 'Save Link As...' or 'Save Target As..' and save as xml file to your desktop. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/views/template_cruise.css Cascading Stylesheet (CSS)] ** Right click on link, select 'Copy Link Location' or 'Copy Shortcut' and paste into URL in template. ** e.g.:
==Examples== [[Media:cruise_example.pdf|Example]] (pdf) * This example describes the Arctic cruise on the Healy from August 2005. [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/NOAA/NESDIS/NGDC/MGG/Cruise/iso/ Cruise Level Metadata WAF] * Many other examples of cruise level metadata at NGDC ==Validation Resources== Right click on links, select 'Copy Link Location' or 'Copy Shortcut' and paste URL into XML Editor for validation. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema.xsd XML Schema Document] - 19139 for all ISO 19115/19115-2 metadata * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schematron/cruise_template_schematron.sch Schematron Checker for cruise template]
[http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/mgg/ecs/metadata/ ECS Metadata Home] [[Category:ECS]]

[[Category:ECS]] These metadata templates are used for describing raw or minimally processed gravity data. This is a collaborative effort between the NOAA National Geophysical Data Center, the U.S. Geological Survey, the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), and the Rolling Deck to Repository (R2R). This template is designed with the ISO 19115, ISO 19115-2 and ISO 19139 metadata standards. You may use the XML Schema document (XSD) to validate the XML and the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) for displaying the XML in the Firefox browser and editing the XML in the Oxygen XML Editor. ==Guide== * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Training/Guides/gravity_template_guide.html Template Guide] * [[ISO Template Vocabularies|Vocabulary]] ==XML Templates== This is an xml template that can be used to begin the development of your metadata record. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Examples/iso/xml/template_gravity.xml Template] ** Right click on link, select 'Save Link As...' or 'Save Target As..' and save as xml file to your desktop. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/views/template_grav_mag.css Cascading Stylesheet (CSS)] ** Right click on link, select 'Copy Link Location' or 'Copy Shortcut' and paste into URL in template. ** e.g.:
==Examples== [[Media:gravity_example.pdf|Example]] (pdf) ==Validation Resources== Right click on links, select 'Copy Link Location' or 'Copy Shortcut' and paste URL into XML Editor for validation. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema.xsd XML Schema Document] - 19139 for all ISO 19115/19115-2 metadata
[http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/mgg/ecs/metadata/ ECS Metadata Home]

[[Category:ECS]] These metadata templates are used for describing raw or minimally processed magnetic data. This is a collaborative effort between the NOAA National Geophysical Data Center, the U.S. Geological Survey, the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), and the Rolling Deck to Repository (R2R). This template is designed with the ISO 19115, ISO 19115-2 and ISO 19139 metadata standards. You may use the XML Schema document (XSD) to validate the XML and the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) for displaying the XML in the Firefox browser and editing the XML in the Oxygen XML Editor. ==Guide== * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Training/Guides/magnetic_template_guide.html Template Guide] * [[ISO Template Vocabularies| Vocabulary]] ==XML Templates== This is an xml template that can be used to begin the development of your metadata record. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Examples/iso/xml/template_magnetic.xml Template] ** Right click on link, select 'Save Link As...' or 'Save Target As..' and save as xml file to your desktop. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/views/template_grav_mag.css Cascading Stylesheet (CSS)] ** Right click on link, select 'Copy Link Location' or 'Copy Shortcut' and paste into URL in template. ** e.g.:
==Example== [[Media:magnetic_example.pdf|Example]] (pdf) ==Validation Resources== Right click on links, select 'Copy Link Location' or 'Copy Shortcut' and paste URL into XML Editor for validation. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema.xsd XML Schema Document] - 19139 for all ISO 19115/19115-2 metadata
[http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/mgg/ecs/metadata/ ECS Metadata Home]

[[Category:ECS]] This metadata template describes the raw or minimally processed multibeam data for ECS. This is a collaborative effort between the NOAA National Geophysical Data Center, the Rolling Deck to Repository (R2R), the Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory, the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), and the University of New Hampshire (UNH). This template is designed with the ISO 19115, ISO 19115-2 and ISO 19139 metadata standards. You may use the XML Schema document (XSD) to validate the XML and the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) for displaying the XML in the Firefox browser and editing the XML in the Oxygen XML Editor. ==Guide== * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Training/Guides/multibeam_manifest_template_guide.html Series and File Manifest Template Guide] * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Training/Guides/multibeam_template_guide.html Series and File Level Template Guide] * [[ISO Template Vocabularies|Vocabulary]] ==XML Templates== This is an xml template that can be used to begin the development of your metadata record. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Examples/iso/xml/template_multibeam_seriesLevel.xml Series Level Template] * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Examples/iso/xml/template_multibeam_fileLevel.xml File Level Template] ** Right click on link, select 'Save Link As...' or 'Save Target As..' and save as xml file to your desktop. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/views/template_multibeam.css Cascading Stylesheet (CSS)] ** Right click on link, select 'Copy Link Location' or 'Copy Shortcut' and paste into URL in template. ** e.g.:
==Examples== *[[Media:me70_seriesLevel_example.pdf|Series Level Example]] (pdf) *[[Media:me70_fileLevel_example.pdf|File Level Example]] (pdf) ==Validation Resources== Right click on links, select 'Copy Link Location' or 'Copy Shortcut' and paste URL into XML Editor for validation. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema.xsd XML Schema Document] - 19139 for all ISO 19115/19115-2 metadata
[http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/mgg/ecs/metadata/ ECS Metadata Home]

[[Category:ECS]] These metadata templates are used for describing gridded datasets. This is a collaborative effort between the NOAA National Geophysical Data Center, the U.S. Geological Survey, the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), and the Rolling Deck to Repository (R2R). This template is designed with the ISO 19115, ISO 19115-2 and ISO 19139 metadata standards. You may use the XML Schema document (XSD) to validate the XML and the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) for displaying the XML in the Firefox browser and editing the XML in the Oxygen XML Editor. ==Guide== * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Training/Guides/grid_template_guide.html Template Guide] * [[ISO Template Vocabularies| Vocabulary]] ==XML Templates== This is an xml template that can be used to begin the development of your metadata record. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Examples/iso/xml/template_grid.xml Template] ** Right click on link, select 'Save Link As...' or 'Save Target As..' and save as xml file to your desktop. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/views/template_grid.css Cascading Stylesheet (CSS)] ** Right click on link, select 'Copy Link Location' or 'Copy Shortcut' and paste into URL in template. ** e.g.:
== Examples == *[[Media:Wmmexample.pdf|World Magnetic Model Example]] (pdf) *[[Media:Demexample.pdf|Digital Elevation Model Example]] (pdf) ==Validation Resources== Right click on links, select 'Copy Link Location' or 'Copy Shortcut' and paste URL into XML Editor for validation. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema.xsd XML Schema Document] - 19139 for all ISO 19115/19115-2 metadata
[http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/mgg/ecs/metadata/ ECS Metadata Home]

[[Category:ECS]] These metadata templates are used for preliminary, shipboard observations made about ECS geologic samples. More detailed post-cruise descriptions or analyses will not use these forms. This is a collaborative effort between the NOAA National Geophysical Data Center, the U.S. Geological Survey, the System for Earth Sample Registry (SESAR) at the Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory, the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO), and the Rolling Deck to Repository (R2R). This template is designed with the ISO 19115, ISO 19115-2 and ISO 19139 metadata standards. You may use the XML Schema document (XSD) to validate the XML. ==Guide== * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Training/Guides/core_template_guide.html Core Template Guide] * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Training/Guides/dredge_template_guide.html Dredge Template Guide] * [[ISO Template Vocabularies|Vocabulary]] ==XML Templates== These xml templates that can be used to begin the development of your metadata records. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Examples/iso/xml/template_core.xml Core Template] * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/Examples/iso/xml/template_dredge.xml Dredge Template] ** Right click on link, select 'Save Link As...' or 'Save Target As..' and save as xml file to your desktop. ==Examples== * [[Media:core-example.pdf|Core Example]] (pdf) * [[Media:dredge_example.pdf|Dredge Example]] (pdf) ==Validation Resources== Right click on links, select 'Copy Link Location' or 'Copy Shortcut' and paste URL into XML Editor for validation. * [http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema.xsd XML Schema Document] - 19139 for all ISO 19115/19115-2 metadata
[http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/mgg/ecs/metadata/ ECS Metadata Home]

[http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/mgg/ecs/metadata ECS Metadata Template for Multibeam]
[[Category: ECS]]
